data.text:
Wall St. Bears Claw Back Into the Black (Reuters) Reuters - Short-sellers, Wall Street's dwindling
band of ultra-cynics, are seeing green again.

Carlyle Looks Toward Commercial Aerospace (Reuters) Reuters - Private investment firm Carlyle Group,
which has a reputation for making well-timed and occasionally
controversial plays in the defense industry, has quietly placed
its bets on another part of the aerospace market.

Oil and Economy Cloud Stocks' Outlook (Reuters) Reuters - Soaring crude prices plus worries about the
economy and the outlook for earnings are expected to hang over
the stock market next week during the depth of the summer
doldrums.

Iraq Halts Oil Exports from Main Southern Pipeline (Reuters) Reuters - Authorities have halted oil export
flows from the main pipeline in southern Iraq after
intelligence showed a rebel militia could strike the
infrastructure, an oil official said on Saturday.

Oil prices soar to all-time record, posing new threat to US economy (AFP) AFP - Tearaway world oil prices, toppling records and straining wallets, present a new economic menace just as the US economy is trying to find its feet.

Stocks End Up, But Near Year Lows (Reuters) Reuters - Stocks ended slightly higher on Friday
but stayed near lows for the year as oil prices surged past #36;46
a barrel, offsetting a positive outlook from computer maker
Dell Inc. (DELL.O)

Money Funds Fell in Latest Week (AP) AP - Assets of the nation's retail money market mutual funds fell by #36;1.17 billion in the latest week to #36;849.98 trillion, the Investment Company Institute said Thursday.

Fed minutes show dissent over inflation (USATODAY.com) USATODAY.com - Retail sales bounced back a bit in July, and new claims for jobless benefits fell last week, the government said Thursday, indicating the economy is improving from a midsummer slump.
Safety Net (Forbes.com) Forbes.com - After earning a PH.D. in Sociology, Danny Sjursen became a working-class hero by solving a safety problem at a rubber factory.

Wall St. Bears Claw Back Into the Black (Reuters) Reuters - Short-sellers, Wall Street's dwindling
band of ultra-cynics, are seeing green again.

Microsoft to begin selling stripped-down version of Windows XP in Asia (AFP) AFP - Microsoft said it would begin selling a cheaper, stripped-down version of its Windows XP operating system in five Asian countries in October.
P2P traffic tops Web, report says (CNET) CNET - Peer-to-peer applications, specifically eDonkey, now drive the most traffic on the Internet, according to a recent study.

IBM to Hire 18,800 workers this year (Reuters) Reuters - International Business Machines Corp. said on Thursday it planned to hire 18,800 people this year, most of them in its fast-growing services division.

Sun to Offer its 'Java Desktop System' to China (Reuters) Reuters - Sun Microsystems Inc. on Thursday said it
had signed an agreement with the Chinese government to supply
millions of copies of its desktop operating system and software
in the world's most populous nation.

Wrapup: Phelps wins fifth gold, U.S. basketball stunned (Reuters) Reuters - Michael Phelps won his fifth gold medal of the Athens Olympics on Friday but the U.S. men's basketball team suffered another shock defeat.

Greek Sprinters Fail to Appear at Hearing (AP) AP - For the Greek people, the Athens Olympics were supposed to be a source of pride, an opportunity to show the world they could pull off a spectacularly successful games. In just a few short days, however, the mood has turned from celebration to shame.
Roddick into semi-finals in Cincinnati (AFP) AFP - Top seed Andy Roddick beat German Tommy Haas 6-3, 6-3 to reach the semi-finals of the 2.45 million dollar Cincinnati Masters tennis tournament.

U.S. Men's Basketball Team Beats Australia (AP) AP - The U.S. men's basketball team defeated Australia 89-79 Thursday to advance to the semifinals of the Olympic tournament. The Americans will play Argentina, which beat Greece 69-64.
Is this the end for the PC? (CNET) CNET - The PC is losing its dominance as the center of the digital home, according to a new report from Forrester Research.

Google IPO filing update indicates size of offering (MarketWatch) MarketWatch - Google updated its IPO filing Thursday morning with the Securities and Exchange Commission, indicating the company will sell 14.1 million shares and existing holders will sell 11.6 million shares.
